job.title: VerkäuferIn 100%
job.plaincontent:
Wenn Sie Grosses bewegen wollen, sollten wir uns bald kennen lernen.OTTO’S ist ein erfolgreiches Detailhandelsunternehmen mit rund 2000 Mitarbeitenden und über 100 Filialen in der ganzen Schweiz. Unser Erfolg basiert unter anderem auf einem top motivierten Team, dessen Fähigkeiten wir laufend fördern und unterstützen.Für unsere Filiale Pratteln (BL) suchen wir per sofortVerkäuferInFood/Non–Food – Vollzeit, 100%Ihr künftiges Aufgabengebiet
- Beratung und Betreuung der Kundschaft - Warenpräsentation - Warenkontrolle und Beschriftung - Kassa- und Abrechnungswesen
Ihr Anforderungsprofil
- Abgeschlossene Lehre im Detailhandel oder mehrjährige Berufserfahrung in den Bereichen Food/Non-Food - Bereitschaft zur Teamarbeit - Freude am Umgang mit Menschen - Belastbarkeit in hektischen Momenten - Gute körperliche Verfassung - Gute Deutschkenntnisse (schriftlich und mündlich)
Das dürfen Sie von uns erwarten
- Faire Anstellungsbedingungen - Familiäres Arbeitsklima in einem dynamischen, spannenden Umfeld - Realistische Zukunftsperspektiven - Attraktive Einkaufsvergünstigungen
Nutzen Sie Ihre Chance und bewerben Sie sich jetzt Einfach Ihre Bewerbung online ausfüllen und absenden.

job.title: Stv. Filialleitung 100%
job.plaincontent:
Für unser SPORT OUTLET in Sursee (LU) suchen wir per sofortStv. FilialleitungSport – Vollzeit, 100%Ihr künftiges Aufgabengebiet
- Unterstützung der Filialleitung in der täglichen Arbeit - Kompetente und aktive Beratung unserer Kundschaft (Mehrfachbedienung) - Koordination und Überwachung der Warenpräsentation und Verkaufsförderung - Warenkontrolle und deren Beschriftung sowie eine optimale Lagerbewirtschaftung - Kassa- und Abrechnungswesen
Ihr Anforderungsprofil

Das dürfen Sie von uns erwarten
- Faire Anstellungsbedingungen - Familiäres Arbeitsklima in einem dynamischen, spannenden Umfeld - Realistische Zukunftsperspektiven - Attraktive Einkaufsvergünstigungen
Nutzen Sie Ihre Chance und bewerben Sie sich jetzt Einfach Ihre Bewerbung online ausfüllen und absenden.

job.title: Ergotherapeut/in 90%
job.plaincontent:
Ergotherapeut/in
90%per sofort oder nach VereinbarungAarau Ihre Aufgaben Ihre Tätigkeit besteht in der Behandlung von stationären und ambulanten Handpatientinnen und -patienten in der Akutphase sowie in weiterführenden ambulanten Einzeltherapien. Sie betreuen Patientinnen und Patienten der Handchirurgie, Rheumatologie, Orthopädie und Traumatologie. Ihr Profil Sie haben eine abgeschlossene Ausbildung als Ergotherapeut/in (WFOT-Anerkennung), idealerweise mit Erfahrung in Schienenbau, Handtherapie und Ergonomie. Wir suchen eine teamfähige, engagierte und belastbare Persönlichkeit mit einer selbständigen und speditiven Arbeitsweise. Sie sind flexibel, in interdisziplinärer Zusammenarbeit geübt und arbeiten gerne innerhalb einer schnelllebigen Arbeitswelt. Wir freuen uns auf Ihre Online-Bewerbung Jetzt bewerbenDruckenTeilen
Weitere Informationen und Online Bewerbung auf www.ksa.ch/jobs
Haben Sie Fragen? Frau Waltraud Knaus, Leitende Ergotherapeutin und Frau Sandra Zulauf, Stv. Leitende Ergotherapeutin, beantworten Ihnen diese gerne.+41 62 838 45 41

job.title: Geschäftsführung (80 %) 80 %
job.plaincontent:
«Stadt und Land mitenand»
Die weite, sanfte Landschaft ist prägend für den Lebens- und Wirtschaftsraum der Regio Frauenfeld. In der Regionalplanungsgruppe sind die Stadt Frauenfeld und die umliegenden 14 Gemeinden zusammengeschlossen. Primäres Ziel ist die nachhaltige Entwicklung der Region durch Initiierung von Projekten, Stärkung der Zusammenarbeit und Interessenvertretung gegenüber Dritten. Für die Leitung, Begleitung und Umsetzung von Projekten in unterschiedlichen Politikbereichen sowie die Weiterentwicklung der Organisation, suchen wir eine engagierte Persönlichkeit für die
Geschäftsführung (80 %)
Ihre Aufgaben
- Regions- und Agglomerationsentwicklung: Projektinitiierung, Mittelbeschaffung, Projektleitungen in Zusammenarbeit mit dem Vorstand, den Gemeinden und weiteren ProjektpartnerInnen so z.B. Umsetzung der Massnahmen aus dem Agglomerationsprogramm im ländlichen Raum, Umsetzung von Schlüsselprojekten - Leitung der Geschäftsstelle und Weiterentwicklung der Organisation - Vertretung in Fachgremien - Kommunikation und Information der Mitglieder und der NetzwerkpartnerInnen, Öffentlichkeitsarbeit
Ihr Profil
- GeneralistIn vorzugsweise mit Hochschulabschluss in Raumplanung, Geographie, Umwelt- oder Politikwissenschaften - einige Jahre Berufs- und Projektleitungserfahrung - initiative und selbstständige Arbeitsweise - kommunikativ, teamorientiert - ziel- und ergebnisorientiert - Interesse an der Regionalentwicklung
Unser Angebot
- grosse Gestaltungs- und Handlungsmöglichkeiten in vielfältigen Themenfeldern und Projekten - verantwortungsvolle, abwechslungsreiche Tätigkeit mit Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten
Für weitere Auskünfte steht Ihnen die jetzige Stelleninhaberin Brigitte Fürer, +41 052 724 53 24 zur Verfügung.
Haben wir Ihr Interesse geweckt? Dann freuen wir uns über Ihre Bewerbung an Brigitte.Fuerer@regiofrauenfeld.ch. www.regiofrauenfeld.ch

job.title: Pharma-Assistentin im Applikationssupport (w/m)
job.plaincontent:
Pharma-Assistent/in im Applikationssupport
Zur Verstärkung unserer Abteilung Operations suchen wir eine/n
Pharma-Assistent/in im Applikationssupport
Ihre Mission
- Dank Ihrer Erfahrung beraten und unterstützen Sie unsere Kunden am Telefon und per Fernwartung rund um die Applikationen - Sie schulen und begleiten künftige AnwenderInnen vor Ort oder im Hause - Sie helfen mit bei Inbetriebnahmen neuer Lösungen - Sie testen die neuen Funktionen und Programm-Updates, bei Bedarf passen Sie die Dokumentation an
Ihr Profil
- Sie verfügen über eine abgeschlossene Berufslehre als Pharma-AssistentIn oder bringen vergleichbare Erfahrungen mit (z.B. DrogistIn) - Sie haben Kenntnisse und/oder Flair für Informatik - Sie schätzen intensiven Kundenkontakt sehr und Hilfsbereitschaft gehört zu Ihren Stärken - Ihre Muttersprache ist Deutsch - Kenntnisse der Applikationen „Golden Gate“ und/oder „Tactil“ sind von Vorteil - Sie zögern nicht, Initiative zu ergreifen und schätzen sowohl selbständiges, exaktes Arbeiten wie auch das Arbeiten im und mit anderen Teams
Wir bieten Ihnen eine abwechslungsreiche und interessante Tätigkeit in einem gut funktionierenden Team, sowie die Gelegenheit, Ihre Kenntnisse in einem für Sie neuen Gebiet einzusetzen.
Arbeitsbeginn : sofort oder nach Vereinbarung Beschäftigungsgrad : 100% Arbeitsort : Neuenegg (Bern)
Wenn Sie diese Aufgabe anspricht und Sie die nötigen Fähigkeiten mitbringen , freuen wir uns auf Ihr vollständiges Bewerbungsdossier (Motivationsschreiben, Lebenslauf, Kopien von Diplomen und Arbeitszeugnissen):
Pharmatic AG Human Resources Laupenstrasse 11, Postfach 34, 3176 Neuenegg hr@pharmatic.ch, www.pharmatic.ch
Es werden nur vollständige, dem Profil entsprechende Bewerbungen beantwortet.

job.title: Developer .NET Master Data Management (w/m)
job.plaincontent:
Developer .NET Master Data Management (w/m)
Zur Verstärkung unserer Abteilung Entwicklung suchen wir eine/n
Developer .NET Master Data Management (w/m)
Ihre Mission
- Ihre Erfahrung ermöglicht es Ihnen die Entwicklung zukünftiger Funktionen für unsere Produkte erfolgreich auszuführen - In Zusammenarbeit mit dem Team nehmen Sie aktiv an der Entwicklung und Betreuung der Applikationen teil, welche bei unseren Kunden installiert sind - Die technische Analyse für neue Funktionen gehört ebenfalls zu Ihren Tätigkeiten - Sie gewährleisten des Weiteren den 3rd Level Support
Ihr Profil
- Sie bringen Erfahrung als Entwickler VB.NET oder C# mit (mind. 3 Jahre), hauptsächlich asp.net.mvc-5 - Delphi-Kenntnisse sind ein Vorteil (stellvertretende Rolle für ein Produkt unserer Gruppe) - Sie beherrschen die Programmierung OO sowie folgende Technologien: .NET Framework, Web Services, XML, JSon - Sie haben gute Kenntnisse der Sprache T-SQL (MS SQL Server) - Ihre Muttersprache ist Deutsch oder Französisch mit Kenntnissen der anderen Sprache - Sie sind sehr pflichtbewusst und flexibel, verfügen über eine exakte, selbständige und methodische Arbeitsweise und schätzen die Arbeit im Team sowie auch selbstständiges Arbeiten
Wir bieten Ihnen
- Die Gelegenheit, aktiv an der Entwicklung in einem marktführenden Unternehmen teilzunehmen - Eine abwechslungsreiche und interessante Stelle in einem modernen und lebhaften Geschäftsumfeld - Attraktive Anstellungsbedingungen
Arbeitsort : Neuenegg (BE) Beschäftigungsgrad : 80 - 100% Arbeitsbeginn : ab sofort oder nach Vereinbarung
Wenn Sie diese Aufgabe anspricht und Sie die nötigen Fähigkeiten mitbringen , freuen wir uns auf Ihr vollständiges Bewerbungsdossier (Motivationsschreiben, Lebenslauf, Kopien von Diplomen und Arbeitszeugnissen):
Pharmatic AG Human Resources Laupenstrasse 11, Postfach 34, 3176 Neuenegg hr@pharmatic.ch, www.pharmatic.ch

job.title: Nachdiplomstudium dipl. Expertin/Experte Intensivpflege HF für Pädiatrie
job.plaincontent:
Im Kantonsspital Graubünden in Chur arbeiten rund 2'200 Mitarbeitende. Das moderne Zentrumsspital der Südostschweiz bietet attraktive Arbeitsplätze in mehr als 50 Berufen an.Im interdisziplinären Team auf der Intensivstation ist die diplomierten Expertinnen und Experten Intensivpflege gemeinsam mit der Ärzteschaft verantwortlich für lebensbedrohlich erkrankte oder verunfallte Patientinnen und Patienten. Sie müssen unter hoher Belastung wirkungsvoll im Team zusammenarbeiten und in Notfallsituationen die richtigen Prioritäten setzen.
Wir suchen jeweils auf anfangs Oktober Dipl. Pflegefachpersonen HF für das zweijährige
Nachdiplomstudium dipl. Expertin/Experte Intensivpflege HF für Pädiatrie
100%Ihre Hauptaufgaben:
- Als diplomierte Expertinnen/Experten Intensivpflege HF führen Sie die Betreuung der Patientinnen und Patienten situationsgerecht durch und setzen technische Hilfsmittel und Geräte gezielt und fachgerecht ein. - Diese Weiterbildung vermittelt technisches und pathophysiologisches Wissen ebenso wie verrichtungsorientiertes Handeln. Darüber hinaus sind psychosoziale, ethische und familienbezogene Grundlagen von Relevanz. - Das dritte und vierte Semester inklusive Diplomabschluss werden im Kinderspital Zürich auf der Intensivstation durchgeführt.
Ihr Anforderungsprofil:
- Abgeschlossene Ausbildung als dipl. Pflegefachpersonen HF/FH oder ein vom Staatssekretariat für Bildung, Forschung und Innovation (SBFI) anerkanntes ausländisches Diplom in Pflege - Erfahrung auf einer pädiatrischen Akutabteilung - Je nach Erfahrung in der Neonatologie oder Pädiatrie ist ein frühzeitigerer Stellenantritt erwünscht
Für weitere Fragen wenden Sie sich an Christophe D'Onofrio, Pflegeleiter und Stv. Departementsleiter Kinder- und Jugendendmedizin, Telefon +41 81 256 64 09.Erfahren Sie mehr über unsere Kinder- und Jugendmedizin und Ihre Vorteile bei uns im Kantonsspital Graubünden.
Wir freuen uns auf Ihre vollständige Online-Bewerbung.Jetzt online bewerbenBei uns sind Sie in besten Händen

job.title: Grundausbildung Informatiker/-in
job.plaincontent:
Im Kantonsspital Graubünden in Chur arbeiten rund 2'200 Mitarbeitende. Das moderne Zentrumsspital der Südostschweiz bietet attraktive Arbeitsplätze in mehr als 50 Berufen an.Informatiker/-innen sind gesuchte Fachleute und vielseitig einsetzbar. Die vierjährige Grundausbildung mit der Fachrichtung Betriebsinformatik bietet dir eine solide Basis für den Berufseinstieg.
Wir suchen per 1. August 2021 Lernende für die
Grundausbildung Informatiker/-in
100%Deine Hauptaufgaben:
- Mitarbeit beim Erstellen von Informatikkonzepten - Überwachung, Betrieb und Unterhalt von Server- und Netzwerk-Systemen - Unterstützung von Anwender/-innen - Hard- und Software installieren und in Betrieb nehmen - Programme erstellen, modifizieren und testen
Dein Anforderungsprofil:
- Gute Schulnoten auf einem Sekundarniveau - Interesse an der Mathematik, naturwissenschaftlichen Fächern und an den Sprachen Deutsch und Englisch - Sinn für theoretische und technische Zusammenhänge - Freude an exakter Denk- und Arbeitsweise - Experimentierfreudig
Möchtest du den Beruf Informatiker/-in mit der Fachrichtung Betriebsinformatik kennen lernen? Dann bieten wir dir die Möglichkeit, während zwei Tagen Informatiker-Luft zu schnuppern .
Für weitere Fragen wende dich an Heiner Leuzinger, Ausbildungsverantwortlicher Informatik, Telefon +41 81 256 60 61.Erfahre mehr über unsere Informatik und deine Vorteile bei uns im Kantonsspital Graubünden.
Wir freuen uns auf deine vollständige Online-Bewerbung.Jetzt online bewerbenBei uns sind Sie in besten Händen

job.title: Grundausbildung Medizinische/-r Praxisassistent/-in
job.plaincontent:
Im Kantonsspital Graubünden in Chur arbeiten rund 2'200 Mitarbeitende. Das moderne Zentrumsspital der Südostschweiz bietet attraktive Arbeitsplätze in mehr als 50 Berufen an.Im 2021 bieten wir erstmals eine Grundausbildung als Medizinische/-r Praxisassistent/-in EFZ an. Die Grundausbildung wird in einer Stammstation der Zentralen Notfallstation oder Medizinischen Polyklinik absolviert. Um weitere Erfahrung zu sammeln ist eine Rotation in die Bereiche Röntgen, Labor und Abrechnungswesen vorgesehen. Du suchst einen Beruf mit Perspektiven, bei dem du Menschen hilfst und viel Abwechslung bekommst?
Wir suchen per 1. August 2021 Lernende für die dreijährige
Grundausbildung Medizinische/-r Praxisassistent/-in
100%Deine Hauptaufgaben:
- Du unterstützt die Ärzteschaft beim Behandeln der Patientinnen und Patienten, führst Tests aus, nimmst Blut ab und kannst es in der internen Hausarztpraxis teilweise auch selber analysieren - Du vereinbarst Termine, empfängst Patientinnen und Patienten und erfasst die Daten im System - Du schreibst Berichte ab Diktat oder führst die elektronische Patientendossiers - Im internen Röntgeninstitut lernst du korrekte Bilder zu erstellen und diese zu beurteilen
Dein Anforderungsprofil:
- Abgeschlossene obligatorische Schulzeit - Gute Leistungen in Biologie, Chemie und Physik - Freude an Kontakt mit Menschen und Einfühlungsvermögen - Verantwortungsbewusstsein, Zuverlässigkeit und genaue Arbeitsweise - Verschwiegenheit aufgrund der ärztlichen Schweigepflicht
Für weitere Fragen wende dich an Nicole Bearth-Koch, Teamleiterin MPA Zentrale Notfallstation, Telefon +41 81 256 71 37.Erfahre mehr über das Kantonsspital und deine Vorteile bei uns im Kantonsspital Graubünden.
Wir freuen uns auf deine vollständige Online-Bewerbung.Jetzt online bewerbenBei uns sind Sie in besten Händen

job.title: ICT System Engineer
job.plaincontent:
Im Kantonsspital Graubünden in Chur arbeiten rund 2'200 Mitarbeitende. Das moderne Zentrumsspital der Südostschweiz bietet attraktive Arbeitsplätze in mehr als 50 Berufen an.Die Informatikabteilung mit rund 50 Mitarbeitenden ist für die Informatikanwendungen und die entsprechende moderne ICT-Infrastruktur verantwortlich. Sind Sie eine kommunikative, aufgestellte Persönlichkeit und zeichnen sich durch hohe Flexibilität und Dienstleistungsbereitschaft aus?
Wir suchen Sie per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung als
ICT System Engineer
80 - 100%Ihre Hauptaufgaben:
- Unterstützung des Betriebes im Datacenter Services Team - Weiterentwicklung interner Standards und Vorantreiben der Automation in Projekt und Betrieb - Integration medizinisch-technischer Geräte - Technische Umsetzung von ICT-Projekten und Unterstützung im Projekt-Management - Planen und Durchführen von Applikations-Releases - Selbstständiges Erstellen von Konzepten und Pflichtenheften - Übernahme von Pikettdienst
Ihr Anforderungsprofil:
- Abgeschlossenes Informatikstudium FH/HF mit mehrjähriger Berufserfahrung - In den Bereichen Linux (Redhat), Windows Server Administration, IoT, DNS und Proxy sind Sie fit - Idealerweise Kenntnisse in Container (Docker) und Cloud Lösungen - Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift, sehr gutes Verständnis von Schweizerdeutsch, sowie Grundkenntnisse in Englisch - Selbstständige und effiziente Arbeitsweise sowie die Fähigkeit, sich in unser Team zu integrieren
Für weitere Fragen wenden Sie sich an Herrn Michele Donnicola, Abteilungsleiter ICT-Infrastrukturmanagement, Telefon +41 81 256 60 68.Erfahren Sie mehr über unsere Informatik und Ihre Vorteile bei uns im Kantonsspital Graubünden.
Wir freuen uns auf Ihre vollständige Online-Bewerbung.Jetzt online bewerbenBei uns sind Sie in besten Händen

job.title: Abteilungsleiter/-in Baulicher Brandschutz - Unternehmensstandort 4528 Zuchwil
job.plaincontent:
Abteilungsleiter/-in Baulicher Brandschutz - Unternehmensstandort 4528 Zuchwil
Wir sind das Traditionsunternehmen für technische Isolierungen und baulichen Brandschutz mit sechs Standorten in der Schweiz.
Zur Verstärkung der Niederlassung Solothurn (Zuchwil) suchen wir eine/n Abteilungsleiter/-in baulicher Brandschutz
Marktführer in der Baunebenbranche
Brandschutz, Dämmung und Isolation sind unseren Kernkompetenzen. Als unabhängiges Schweizer Familienunternehmen haben wir uns in den letzten 140 Jahren eine markführende Position erarbeitet. Die treue Kundschaft schätzt die erstklassige Beratung sowie die hohe Qualität der Dienstleistungen. Für die Administration, dort wo der Puls des Unternehmens schlägt, suchen wir ab sofort oder nach Vereinbarung eine sympathische und initiative Persönlichkeit als:
Abteilungsleiter/in Baulicher Brandschutz
Standort Solothurn (SO)
Ihre Funktion
• Abteilungsleitung inkl. Führen von 3 Projektleitern und ca. 30 Brandschutzmonteuren.
• Kalkulation von Offerten
• Projektmanagement, situatives Verhandeln / Abrechnen der Projekte
• partnerschaftlichen Umgang mit Kunden
• Prozesssteuerung über den gesamten Leistungsbereich und rapportieren an den Geschäftsführer
• Mit gutem Beispiel vorangehend, übernehmen Sie für einen Teilbereich direkte Verantwortung bis und mit Stufe Ausführung.
Ihr Profil
• Grundausbildung von Vorteil im Gipser-, Malerbereich oder in der Haustechnik
• Betriebswirtschaftliche Kompetenzen ergänzen Ihre fundierten Praxiskenntnisse
• Hohe Kommunikationsfähigkeit und Sozialkompetenz
• Starken Persönlichkeit und positive Ausstrahlung
• Führungserfahrung von Vorteil
Haben wir Ihr Interesse geweckt?
Im Gegenzug dürfen Sie vorteilhafte Anstellungsbedingungen, Handlungsspielraum und Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten erwarten. Ein erfolgreiches und erfahrenes Team freut sich darauf, Sie vollumfänglich zu unterstützen. Sollten Sie noch Fragen haben, gibt Ihnen Herr Thomas Kräher gerne Auskunft (079 302 20 13).
Senden Sie Ihre Bewerbungsunterlagen an s.weibel@agi.swiss oder per Post an:
AGI AG für Isolierungen
Persönlich
Frau Sandra Weibel
Gewerbestrasse 2
4528 Zuchwil
Tel. 032 685 70 10
so@agi.swiss – www.agi.swiss
Inserat als PDF

job.title: Pharmafachmitarbeiter Filling Line V
job.plaincontent:
About CSL
With operations in 35+ nations and ~ 22,000 employees worldwide, CSL is driven to develop and deliver a broad range of lifesaving therapies to treat disorders such as hemophilia and primary immune deficiencies, and vaccines to prevent influenza. Our therapies are also used in cardiac surgery, organ transplantation and burn treatment.
CSL is the parent company of CSL Behring and Seqirus. CSL Behring is a global leader in the protein biotherapeutics industry, focused on bringing to market biotherapies used to treat serious and often rare conditions. CSL Behring operates CSL Plasma , one of the world's largest collectors of human plasma, which is used to create CSL’s therapies. Seqirus is the second largest influenza vaccine company in the world and is a transcontinental partner in pandemic preparedness and a major contributor to the prevention and control of influenza globally.
We invite you to take a look at the many career possibilities available around the globe and consider building your promising future at CSL by becoming a member of our team!
Stellenbeschreibung
Gemeinsam in die Zukunft …
CSL Behring ist ein weltweit führendes Biotech-Unternehmen, das sich seinem Versprechen verpflichtet hat, Leben zu retten. In Bern entwickeln und vertreiben wir mit über 1500 Mitarbeitenden lebensrettende Therapien für Menschen mit schweren und seltenen Krankheiten weltweit. Für unseren Standort Bern, suchen wir ein/e
Pharma Fachmitarbeiter Filling Line V (m/w/d)
In dieser verantwortungsvollen Aufgabe sind Sie in einem Team von rund 12 Mitarbeitenden für die aseptische Abfüllung unserer Medikamente zuständig.
Ihr Aufgabengebie t umfasst im Detail:
- Reinraumtätigkeiten: Bedienen der Anlagen, Formatwechsel, sterilisieren der Geräte und Durchführen von Messungen - Protokollieren der ausgeführten Arbeiten - Einhaltung der strengen Arbeitsvorschriften, SOP’s und GMP Richtlinien - Reinigen und desinfizieren der Räume
Wir bieten Ihnen eine abwechslungsreiche Tätigkeit in einem eingespielten interkulturellen Team. Als erfolgreicher Pharmafachmitarbeiter verfügen Sie über folgende
Kompetenzen und Erfahrungen :
- Abgeschlossene Berufsausbildung im Pharma-, Lebensmittel- oder technischen Bereich - Erfahrung in der Lebensmittel- oder Pharmaindustrie - Zuverlässige Arbeitsweise und ein grosses Qualitätsverständnis - Sie sind initiativ, arbeiten detailgetreu und kommunizieren offen - Gute PC-Kenntnisse (MS-Office), gute mündliche und schriftliche Deutschkenntnisse sowie vorzugsweise Englischkenntnisse runden Ihr Profil ab.
Fühlen Sie sich angesprochen? Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre Online-Bewerbung. Ihre Bewerbung sollte ein Motivationsschreiben, einen Lebenslauf/CV sowie Arbeitszeugnisse und Kopien von Diplomen in der Originalsprache und/oder relevante Transkripte beinhalten. Bitte fügen Sie Ihre Dateien, inklusive CV, zu einem Dokument zusammen.
CSL Behring verpflichtet sich dem Prinzip der Chancengleichheit.

job.title: Product Manager
job.plaincontent:
About CSL
With operations in 35+ nations and ~ 22,000 employees worldwide, CSL is driven to develop and deliver a broad range of lifesaving therapies to treat disorders such as hemophilia and primary immune deficiencies, and vaccines to prevent influenza. Our therapies are also used in cardiac surgery, organ transplantation and burn treatment.
CSL is the parent company of CSL Behring and Seqirus. CSL Behring is a global leader in the protein biotherapeutics industry, focused on bringing to market biotherapies used to treat serious and often rare conditions. CSL Behring operates CSL Plasma , one of the world's largest collectors of human plasma, which is used to create CSL’s therapies. Seqirus is the second largest influenza vaccine company in the world and is a transcontinental partner in pandemic preparedness and a major contributor to the prevention and control of influenza globally.
We invite you to take a look at the many career possibilities available around the globe and consider building your promising future at CSL by becoming a member of our team!
Stellenbeschreibung
Innovativ und engagiert für Patienten weltweit.
CSL Behring ist ein weltweit führendes Biotech-Unternehmen, das sich seinem Versprechen verpflichtet hat, Leben zu retten. In Bern entwickeln und vertreiben wir mit über 1500 Mitarbeitenden lebensrettende Therapien für Menschen mit schweren und seltenen Krankheiten weltweit.
Zur Verstärkung unseres Marketingteams in Bern suchen wir eine/n
Product Manager (m/w/d)
In dieser vielseitigen und anspruchsvollen Position sind Sie unter anderem für die erfolgreiche Einführung innovativer Produkte sowie für die Promotion der bestehenden Produktpalette in den entsprechenden Indikationsgebieten verantwortlich.
Zu Ihren Kern-Aufgaben zählen:
- Erstellung, Präsentation und Umsetzung von Marketing- und Launchplänen - Budgetverantwortung - Umsetzung der produktbezogenen Marketingaktivitäten und Erstellung von Promotionsunterlagen - Konkurrenz-Analyse und Erstellung entsprechender Massnahmenpläne - Wichtige Drehscheibenfunktion in verschiedenen Projekten für interne und externe Stakeholder - Enge Zusammenarbeit mit anderen Abteilungen, wie z.B. Medical Affairs, Sales und regionalen Marketing-Funktionen - Aufbau und Pflege von persönlichen Kontakten und der Zusammenarbeit mit Meinungsbildnern aus Klinik und Praxis - Produktspezifische Aus- und Weiterbildung des Aussendienstes - Teilnahme an und Mitorganisation von nationalen sowie internationalen Kongressen und Symposien - Einhaltung von Prozessen und Compliance zu gewährleisten
Sie verfügen über folgende Kompetenzen:
- Naturwissenschaftliches oder pharmazeutisches Hochschulstudium - Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung und Erfolgsnachweis in der Pharmaindustrie, vorzugsweise im Bereich Marketing und Sales - Kenntnisse und Erfahrungen aus den entsprechenden Therapiebereichen von Vorteil (z.B. Hämophilie, Immunologie, Intensivmedizin, Pneumologie oder Gerinnungsstörungen) - Grosses Flair komplexe, wissenschaftliche Sachverhalte schnell zu erfassen und professionell zu kommunizieren - Strategische, analytische, selbstständige und disziplinierte Arbeitsweise - Affinität für betriebswirtschaftliche Fragestellungen - Engagierte, proaktive und kreative Persönlichkeit, Teamplayer - Fähigkeit, Prioritäten zu setzten und in grösseren Projekten die Organisation zu übernehmen - Muttersprache deutsch, verhandlungssicher in Französisch und Englisch
Fühlen Sie sich angesprochen? Dann freuen wir uns auf Ihre Online-Bewerbung. Ihre Bewerbung sollte ein Motivationsschreiben, einen Lebenslauf/CV sowie Arbeitszeugnisse beinhalten.
#Behring

job.title: Senior Director, Regulatory, Hematology TA Lead
job.plaincontent:
About CSL
With operations in 35+ nations and ~ 22,000 employees worldwide, CSL is driven to develop and deliver a broad range of lifesaving therapies to treat disorders such as hemophilia and primary immune deficiencies, and vaccines to prevent influenza. Our therapies are also used in cardiac surgery, organ transplantation and burn treatment.
CSL is the parent company of CSL Behring and Seqirus. CSL Behring is a global leader in the protein biotherapeutics industry, focused on bringing to market biotherapies used to treat serious and often rare conditions. CSL Behring operates CSL Plasma , one of the world's largest collectors of human plasma, which is used to create CSL’s therapies. Seqirus is the second largest influenza vaccine company in the world and is a transcontinental partner in pandemic preparedness and a major contributor to the prevention and control of influenza globally.
We invite you to take a look at the many career possibilities available around the globe and consider building your promising future at CSL by becoming a member of our team!
Stellenbeschreibung
CSL Behring is a global biotherapeutics leader driven by its promise to save lives. In Bern more than 1600 employees develop and deliver life-saving therapies to treat people with rare and serious medical conditions worldwide.
For our location in Bern, we are looking for a
Senior Director, Regulatory Therapeutic Area Lead (100%) (m/f/d)
The Senior Director, Regulatory Therapeutic Area Lead is a member of the GRA GPS Leadership Team and contributes to the vision and goals for Global Regulatory Affairs (GRA) by: Providing innovative scientific and regulatory vision, leadership and oversight in defining aligned global regulatory strategies for CSL Behring’s developmental portfolio and core regulatory support for products without ongoing clinical development and accountable for clinical and safety content globally of CSL Behring regulatory documentation for an assigned therapeutic area. Leading and responsible for the activities in a GRA therapeutic area globally and overseeing associated direct reports (as applicable) at CSL Behring’s global facilities, such as in the USA, Germany, Switzerland, Australia, and Japan. Assuring a productive collaboration with key internal therapeutic area stakeholders, such a early and late stage clinical development, commercial development, safety and project management leads, to ensure successful development, strategic alignment and execution of global regulatory strategies that result in successful applications for CSL Behring’s product portfolio, from early development to Marketing Authorization (MA), and for any post MA submissions clinical line extensions. In collaboration with GRA Regional leads, supporting the establishment and maintenance of high quality working relationships with the FDA, EMA, PMDA and other global regulatory agencies for CSL Behring’s therapeutic areas. Lead the GRA Therapeutic Area Team with a focus on collaboration and decision making for the therapeutic area with GRA functional TA & Site Leads, as appropriate. Represents the GRA Therapeutic Area as a core member of the R&D-wide Therapeutic Area Leadership Team.
MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES & ACCOUNTABILITIES
- Work closely with the Head, GRA GPS to maintain an effective, globally minded, Global Regulatory Affairs organization that is focused on utilizing creative problem solving skills, can clearly articulate the science and regulatory perspective to stakeholders, regardless of level and supports effective GRAST teams for assigned therapeutic area. - Contributes to the GRA GPS Leadership Team (GPS LT), appropriately engages GRA Strategy Management Review Team (SMRT) and represents GRA as a core member of the PLG. - Accountable to provide innovative scientific and regulatory leadership in defining the global regulatory strategy for therapeutic area that enable successful submissions and approvals for an assigned therapeutic area during all phases of clinical development (Phase I-->IV). Ensure understanding and worldwide alignment of the global regulatory strategy amongst the GRA GPS Therapeutic Area staff . - Empower and advise the members of GRA GPS therapeutic area to ensure that the project, clinical, CMC and commercial needs for assigned portfolio are met. Additionally, provide strategic and tactical regulatory leadership and guidance for GRLs, Regulatory Scientists/Specialists, as appropriate. - Accountable for clinical / safety related content of all submissions and interactions with the FDA, EMA and other Regulatory Agencies for assigned therapeutic area, working with and through the regional leads (ICH and International Regions). Participate in health authority meetings as required. - Enable growth and professional development of the GRA GPS team members, including succession planning for critical roles with GRALT. Ensures all team members have been trained on their role. - Responsible to lead GRA Therapeutic Area team to assure delivery of innovative and competitive solutions to accelerate program development, prioritize activities, drive decision making, reduce risks and increase success rate for therapeutic area activities. Collaborates with partner GRA Therapeutic Area / Site Leads and represents GRA at respective governance for assigned therapeutic area. - Implement and maintain global regulatory processes and operations for GPS, including GRAST operations. Implement/utilize electronic systems in line with GRA Operational Excellence. - When acting as a GRL in limited situations, serve as the Primary Regulatory Interface on the Core Project Team (CPT), Clinical Development Team (CDT) and Safety Management Team (SMT) for GRA, advocate and drive the ‘one GRA’ perspective with team stakeholders. Accountable for scientific clinical / safety related regulatory submission content globally for assigned products. - Focuses on team leadership by Driving Performance, Building Productive Teams, Developing People and Creating the Future. - On behalf of GRA, reviews and approves Target Product Profiles (TPPs) and Target Product Claims (TPCs) for the Therapeutic Area product portofolio.
QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE
Education:
- A bachelor degree (four-year university degree) in pharmacy, biology, chemistry, pharmacology, clinical medicine or related life science is required. An advanced degree in a related field is preferred (MS, PhD or MD, DVM). Ideal candidates will have a strong clinical foundation.
Experience:
- Minimum of 15 years’ experience in the biotech or pharmaceutical industry, with at least 8 years (prefer 10 years) in Regulatory Affairs - Experience in leading and managing teams (Minimum 5 years), setting clear direction, holding people accountable and fostering a collaborative team environment. - Candidates must have thorough knowledge and understanding of pharmaceutical/biological product development and regulatory requirements for product development and approval in more than one key region (EU, US, Japan) - Experience working in Regulatory Affairs in a global environment across two or more geographic areas (preferentially US and EU). - Extensive experience interfacing with regulatory agencies and proven skill at developing and implementing successful global regulatory strategies. - Experience working in a complex and matrix environment is required - Demonstrated experience in working with multiple stakeholders.
Competencies:
- Strong ethics and integrity - Think strategically and develop innovative global strategies - Leadership ability with demonstrated problem solving and decision making skills - Strong team player with the communication and organizational skills to interact seamlessly both internally and externally on strategic, operational and scientific matters. - Effective communication skills, specifically to related complex concepts to a variety of audiences. - Ability to develop constructive and effective relationships with direct reports, colleagues and senior management. - Proven ability to build and lead effective, well integrated, collaborative teams, empowers others. - Cross cultural sensitivity demonstrating understanding and acceptance of different cultural parameters - Fluency in English (verbal and written)
We are looking forward to receiving your online application. Applications must include a motivation letter and CV, as well as letters of references and copies of relevant transcripts and/or diplomas in the original language. Please include all these in one document together with the CV.
CSL Behring is committed to provide equal employment opportunity for all.

Ensure understanding and worldwide alignment of the global regulatory strategy amongst the GRA GPS Therapeutic Area staff .
  • Empower and advise the members of GRA GPS therapeutic area to ensure that the project, clinical, CMC and commercial needs for assigned portfolio are met. Additionally, provide strategic and tactical regulatory leadership and guidance for GRLs, Regulatory Scientists/Specialists, as appropriate.
  • Accountable for clinical / safety related content of all submissions and interactions with the FDA, EMA and other Regulatory Agencies for assigned therapeutic area, working with and through the regional leads (ICH and International Regions). Participate in health authority meetings as required.
  • Enable growth and professional development of the GRA GPS team members, including succession planning for critical roles with GRALT. Ensures all team members have been trained on their role.
  • Responsible to lead GRA Therapeutic Area team to assure delivery of innovative and competitive solutions to accelerate program development, prioritize activities, drive decision making, reduce risks and increase success rate for therapeutic area activities.   • Implement and maintain global regulatory processes and operations for GPS, including GRAST operations. Implement/utilize electronic systems in line with GRA Operational Excellence.

  • Focuses on team leadership by Driving Performance, Building Productive Teams, Developing People and Creating the Future.

QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE

Experience:

  • Minimum of 15 years’ experience in the biotech or pharmaceutical industry, with at least 8 years (prefer 10 years) in Regulatory Affairs

  • Candidates must have thorough knowledge and understanding of pharmaceutical/biological product development and regulatory requirements for product development and approval in more than one key region (EU, US, Japan)

job.title: Director, Engineering & Design Lead EU/APAC
job.plaincontent:
About CSL
With operations in 35+ nations and ~ 22,000 employees worldwide, CSL is driven to develop and deliver a broad range of lifesaving therapies to treat disorders such as hemophilia and primary immune deficiencies, and vaccines to prevent influenza. Our therapies are also used in cardiac surgery, organ transplantation and burn treatment.
CSL is the parent company of CSL Behring and Seqirus. CSL Behring is a global leader in the protein biotherapeutics industry, focused on bringing to market biotherapies used to treat serious and often rare conditions. CSL Behring operates CSL Plasma , one of the world's largest collectors of human plasma, which is used to create CSL’s therapies. Seqirus is the second largest influenza vaccine company in the world and is a transcontinental partner in pandemic preparedness and a major contributor to the prevention and control of influenza globally.
We invite you to take a look at the many career possibilities available around the globe and consider building your promising future at CSL by becoming a member of our team!
Stellenbeschreibung
For our site in Bern (Or Marburg/Broad meadows), and within the Engineering Standards department, we are looking for a:
Director, Engineering & Design Lead EU/APAC
Reporting into the Global Head of Engineering Standards, the Director, Engineering and Design you will be responsible for oversight of engineering capital investments across the CSL US network and for planning and execution of capital project design phases, compliance with engineering standards, and governance to established engineering processes.
You should be able to demonstrate comprehensive knowledge of End to End (E2E) capital program planning and delivery, engineering processes and platforms, core technical elements related to facilities, utilities and manufacturing equipment, contract management, supporting Quality Systems, and cGMP compliance. You will be responsible for regional and facility type specific engineering standards related to their Engineering function.
As part of a global organization, the position requires approximately 40% travel. Peers will be located across CSL Behring US/EU/APAC sites.
The position requires the ability to build and maintain strong relationships and collaborate effectively with all levels and cross functionally within the organization.
Main Responsibilities and Accountabilities:
Provide Global Engineering Leadership for engineering capital investments across the EU/APAC network
- Partner with internal stakeholders to align on strategies and requirements and develop plans advancing in accordance with established governance processes - Collaborate with Portfolio Management for the planning and execution of capital investments to deliver on strategic commitments - Identify resource requirements and engage internal resources in support of capital investment planning and execution - Responsible for translating stakeholder requirements into tangible strategic and execution plans - Lead E2E capital investment planning; collaborate with Project Delivery to establish integrated plans which meet business objectives - Represent Global Engineering throughout the matrix environment in the communication of capital investment strategies and delivery - Responsible for compliance of capital investments with design standards and standard design platform governance process
Provide Global Engineering Leadership for Engineering Standards
- Responsible for Facility Design Standards related to MAB/Cell Therapy and Aseptic Fill and Finish manufacturing - Collaborate with Global Engineering Process Engineering and Process and Product Owners to establish requirements - Translate process requirements into design attributes which form the basis for Design Standards - Responsible for ensuring harmonization of Facility Design Standards across the global network - Partner with Peers to align on Quality, Safety, IT, Reliability and Sustainability requirements for design standards. Facilitate collaborative sessions to align on design standards attributes to meet requirements - Responsible for ensuring alignment of design standards with Operations Value Streams - Maintain Facility Design Standards throughout Life Cycle - Evaluate innovation and emerging technologies for opportunities to realize efficiency and compliance improvements - Provide training and ensure institutionalization across engineering community
Provide Global Engineering Oversight of external partners for capital investments
- Identify resource requirements and develop plans for external resource engagements - Partner with Global Sourcing to develop engagement strategies, inquiry packages, conditioning and Services Agreements - Provide oversight of external partners and ensure compliance with Engineering Standards - Establish metrics and provide oversight of activities in support of progress measurement and performance - Partner with Project Managers to deliver on tactical execution commitments - Lead Design Reviews to ensure compliance with E2E Portfolio Management and Engineering Standards governance; project management systems, technical, delivery methods, contracting strategies, safety, operational readiness, and Compliance to reduce risk and deliver on business objectives - Utilize design reviews to identify risks and gaps, and to develop mitigation and endorsements prior to advancing through the capital investment process - Leverage internal resources to perform design reviews, partner with Global Sourcing for external augmentation where needed - Lead Peer Reviews to ensure deliverable comply with requirements, standards and stakeholder expectations - Partner with Global Sourcing and provide oversight of process for engaging equipment vendors, and execution of Agreements - Responsible for feedback to Global Sourcing for management of strategic Agreements

- Bachelor’s degree in engineering, biology or related field required, advanced education preferred and/or an MBA. - Minimum of 15 years’ experience in a biotech/pharmaceutical environment in roles with increasing responsibility within the engineering space - Minimum 8 years of managerial experience - Direct experience with oversight of highly complex large engineering capital investments - Excellent management skills and an ability to prioritize effectively to deliver results within aggressive timelines with the ability to work independently and as part of a team - Substantial prior experience in the development and implementation of engineering standards and life cycle management of tools, processes and methodologies - Demonstrated ability to deliver solutions in a dynamic environment - Direct experience with organizational transformation and related supporting engineering processes - Excellent collaboration skills and ability to align people and resources towards organizational success - Must demonstrate strategic thinking and innovative approach to responsibilities - Nimble and comfortable in a fast-paced environment with minimal direction and able to adjust workload based upon changing priorities - Must demonstrate maturity and seasoned judgment in reaching critical decisions - Strong interpersonal skills including verbal and written communication are essential in this collaborative work environment

job.htmlcontent:
About CSL

With operations in 35+ nations and ~ 22,000 employees worldwide, CSL is driven to develop and deliver a broad range of lifesaving therapies to treat disorders such as hemophilia and primary immune deficiencies, and vaccines to prevent influenza. Our therapies are also used in cardiac surgery, organ transplantation and burn treatment.

CSL is the parent company of CSL Behring and Seqirus. CSL Behring is a global leader in the protein biotherapeutics industry, focused on bringing to market biotherapies used to treat serious and often rare conditions. CSL Behring operates CSL Plasma , one of the world's largest collectors of human plasma, which is used to create CSL’s therapies. Seqirus is the second largest influenza vaccine company in the world and is a transcontinental partner in pandemic preparedness and a major contributor to the prevention and control of influenza globally.

We invite you to take a look at the many career possibilities available around the globe and consider building your promising future at CSL by becoming a member of our team!

Stellenbeschreibung

For our site in Bern (Or Marburg/Broad meadows), and within the Engineering Standards department, we are looking for a:

Director, Engineering & Design Lead EU/APAC

Reporting into the Global Head of Engineering Standards, the Director, Engineering and Design you will be responsible for oversight of engineering capital investments across the CSL US network and for planning and execution of capital project design phases, compliance with engineering standards, and governance to established engineering processes.

You should be able to demonstrate comprehensive knowledge of End to End (E2E) capital program planning and delivery, engineering processes and platforms, core technical elements related to facilities, utilities and manufacturing equipment, contract management, supporting Quality Systems, and cGMP compliance. You will be responsible for regional and facility type specific engineering standards related to their Engineering function.

As part of a global organization, the position requires approximately 40% travel. Peers will be located across CSL Behring US/EU/APAC sites.

The position requires the ability to build and maintain strong relationships and collaborate effectively with all levels and cross functionally within the organization.

Main Responsibilities and Accountabilities:

Provide Global Engineering Leadership for engineering capital investments across the EU/APAC network

  • Partner with internal stakeholders to align on strategies and requirements and develop plans advancing in accordance with established governance processes
  • Collaborate with Portfolio Management for the planning and execution of capital investments to deliver on strategic commitments
  • Identify resource requirements and engage internal resources in support of capital investment planning and execution
  • Responsible for translating stakeholder requirements into tangible strategic and execution plans
  • Lead E2E capital investment planning; collaborate with Project Delivery to establish integrated plans which meet business objectives
  • Represent Global Engineering throughout the matrix environment in the communication of capital investment strategies and delivery
  • Responsible for compliance of capital investments with design standards and standard design platform governance process

Provide Global Engineering Leadership for Engineering Standards

  • Responsible for Facility Design Standards related to MAB/Cell Therapy and Aseptic Fill and Finish manufacturing
  • Collaborate with Global Engineering Process Engineering and Process and Product Owners to establish requirements
  • Translate process requirements into design attributes which form the basis for Design Standards
  • Responsible for ensuring harmonization of Facility Design Standards across the global network
  • Partner with Peers to align on Quality, Safety, IT, Reliability and Sustainability requirements for design standards. Facilitate collaborative sessions to align on design standards attributes to meet requirements
  • Responsible for ensuring alignment of design standards with Operations Value Streams
  • Maintain Facility Design Standards throughout Life Cycle
  • Evaluate innovation and emerging technologies for opportunities to realize efficiency and compliance improvements
  • Provide training and ensure institutionalization across engineering community

Provide Global Engineering Oversight of external partners for capital investments

  • Identify resource requirements and develop plans for external resource engagements
  • Partner with Global Sourcing to develop engagement strategies, inquiry packages, conditioning and Services Agreements
  • Provide oversight of external partners and ensure compliance with Engineering Standards
  • Establish metrics and provide oversight of activities in support of progress measurement and performance
  • Partner with Project Managers to deliver on tactical execution commitments
  • Lead Design Reviews to ensure compliance with E2E Portfolio Management and Engineering Standards governance; project management systems, technical, delivery methods, contracting strategies, safety, operational readiness, and Compliance to reduce risk and deliver on business objectives
  • Utilize design reviews to identify risks and gaps, and to develop mitigation and endorsements prior to advancing through the capital investment process
  • Leverage internal resources to perform design reviews, partner with Global Sourcing for external augmentation where needed
  • Lead Peer Reviews to ensure deliverable comply with requirements, standards and stakeholder expectations
  • Partner with Global Sourcing and provide oversight of process for engaging equipment vendors, and execution of Agreements
  • Responsible for feedback to Global Sourcing for management of strategic Agreements

Your Profile:

  • Bachelor’s degree in engineering, biology or related field required, advanced education preferred and/or an MBA.
  • Minimum of 15 years’ experience in a biotech/pharmaceutical environment in roles with increasing responsibility within the engineering space
  • Minimum 8 years of managerial experience 
  • Direct experience with oversight of highly complex large engineering capital investments
  • Excellent management skills and an ability to prioritize effectively to deliver results within aggressive timelines with the ability to work independently and as part of a team
  • Substantial prior experience in the development and implementation of engineering standards and life cycle management of tools, processes and methodologies
  • Demonstrated ability to deliver solutions in a dynamic environment
  • Direct experience with organizational transformation and related supporting engineering processes
  • Excellent collaboration skills and ability to align people and resources towards organizational success
  • Must demonstrate strategic thinking and innovative approach to responsibilities
  • Nimble and comfortable in a fast-paced environment with minimal direction and able to adjust workload based upon changing priorities
  • Must demonstrate maturity and seasoned judgment in reaching critical decisions
  • Strong interpersonal skills including verbal and written communication are essential in this collaborative work environment
     

We are looking forward to receiving your online application. Applications must include a motivation letter and CV, as well as letters of references and copies of relevant transcripts and/or diplomas in the original language. Please include all these in one document together with the CV.

CSL Behring is committed to provide equal employment opportunity for all.

job.title: Senior Director, Global Engineering Quality
job.plaincontent:
About CSL
With operations in 35+ nations and ~ 22,000 employees worldwide, CSL is driven to develop and deliver a broad range of lifesaving therapies to treat disorders such as hemophilia and primary immune deficiencies, and vaccines to prevent influenza. Our therapies are also used in cardiac surgery, organ transplantation and burn treatment.
CSL is the parent company of CSL Behring and Seqirus. CSL Behring is a global leader in the protein biotherapeutics industry, focused on bringing to market biotherapies used to treat serious and often rare conditions. CSL Behring operates CSL Plasma , one of the world's largest collectors of human plasma, which is used to create CSL’s therapies. Seqirus is the second largest influenza vaccine company in the world and is a transcontinental partner in pandemic preparedness and a major contributor to the prevention and control of influenza globally.
We invite you to take a look at the many career possibilities available around the globe and consider building your promising future at CSL by becoming a member of our team!
Stellenbeschreibung
For our site in Bern (Or Marburg/Germany, Kankakee/USA) and within the Global Quality Operations business unit, we are looking for a:
Senior Director, Global Engineering Quality
Reporting to the VP Quality Operations, the Head of Engineering Quality Assurance will be responsible for the Quality oversight and decisions for all of the investment capital projects, validation and technology transfers, and associated regulatory submissions as well as the quality oversight for life cycle management of our products. You will be accountable for process and product quality at each stage of the product life cycle until commercialization.
You will have demonstrated strong technical knowledge, cGMP compliance and Quality by Design execution but also experienced in regulatory strategies and submissions for new products and technology transfers and have experience in associated regulatory inspections and will be responsible for Quality standards and systems aligned with the Engineering function
You will be a member of the Operational Quality Leadership Team and the Engineering Council and will be the Quality partner to the Global Head of Engineering and work closely with members of the Global Engineering Leadership Team. As part of a global organization, the position does require approximately 20% travel. Team members will be located across all CSL Behring sites.The position requires the ability to build and maintain strong relationships and collaborate effectively with all levels and cross functionally within the organization.
Responsibilities:
Provide Quality Assurance Oversight including issue and Risk Management for all capital investment projects
- Collaborate with internal partners for the execution of all capital projects to deliver projects on time and to the required standards - Provide a consistent quality approach to facility, equipment and process design and development for capital - Responsible for Quality decisions for capital projects, including consultation with local Quality leaders - Support regulatory document submissions and pre-approval inspections for capital projects - Support vendor qualification, for capital and other engineering investments
Provide Quality Assurance Oversight including issue and Risk Management,for all technology transfers and validations
- Collaborate with internal partners for the execution of all technology transfers and associated validations to deliver these changes on time and to the required standards - Provide quality oversight and support to all routine validation activities - Responsible for Quality decisions regarding technical transfers and validations, including consultation with local Quality leaders - Support regulatory document submissions and regulatory inspections for technical transfer and validation activities - Provide risk assessments for product quality and compliance and escalate and mitigate risks appropriately
Provide Quality Assurance Oversight including issue and Risk Management for all process engineering and product life cycle management processes
- Partner with the Global Heads of Process Engineering to ensure robust product life cycle management strategies in place to maintain product quality - Responsible for Quality input to Quality by Design principles and processes within R&D product and process development and process engineering - Responsible for Quality input to CPV strategy and processes for all CSL products - Supports global process, technology and product owners for product life cycle management - Responsible for Quality input related to Process & Technology innovation (ie process small scale and computer simulation integration, integration of process analytical technology, external partner technology integration)
Provide Quality Assurance Oversight for Engineering Standards & Engineering Documentation and Knowledge Management
- Support the development and implementation of global engineering standards and processes consistent with regulatory requirements and industry standards - Support the set up and maintenance of an appropriate Documentation and Knowledge Management system for the Engineering function
Provide Leadership to the Engineering Quality Team:
- Provide leadership and guidance to the team of Engineering Quality SMEs based at the manufacturing sites to effectively executive on Quality Assurance oversight related to capital projects, validation and technology transfers and life cycle management of our products - Set objectives and provide clear direction for execution by the SMEs with respect to Engineering Quality
Member of the Quality Operational Leadership Team and Global Engineering Council
- Participate at a senior Quality level in the Global Engineering Council - Leads Quality Management Review for Engineering systems - Member of the Quality Operational Leadership Team across all manufacturing and engineering
Provide Engineering Quality Assurance team leadership
- Provide leadership and guidance to a global team of Engineering Quality Assurance professionals - Set objectives and provide clear direction for execution. - Responsible for organizational design and staffing decisions - Recruit, retain, train and develop the Engineering Quality Assurance team. - Build and sustain employee engagement by creating a culture of efficient execution and an environment in which individuals and teams can excel and continuously improve
Your profile:
- Degree in engineering and/or life sciences ; Advanced degree preferred - Minimum of 12 years’ experience in a pharmaceutical or Bio pharmaceutical Company in roles with increasing responsibility in either coming from Quality Management with knowledge in engineering or from Engineering with good knowledge in Quality Oversight - Minimum 8 years of managerial experience - Direct experience of QA oversight of validation, technology transfers and capital engineering projects - Direct experience executing Quality Assurance function and system within a manufacturing and/or engineering context - Experience in interacting to regulatory authorities including submissions and inspections - Proven ability to build, mentor and grow a high performing team - Ability to influence and motivate others while maintaining a cohesive team environment - Demonstrated ability to influence at all organizational levels through clear, concise and impactful verbal and written communication skills - In-depth knowledge of cGMP’s, FDA, TGA, EU and other relevant GxP regulations - Knowledge of auditing practices and procedures - Effective presentation and meeting skills within all levels of the organization and with external colleagues and collaborators
We are looking forward to receiving your online application. Applications must include a motivation letter and CV, as well as letters of references and copies of relevant transcripts and/or diplomas in the original language. Please include all these in one document together with the CV.
CSL Behring is committed to provide equal employment opportunity for all.

  • Responsible for Quality decisions for capital projects, including consultation with local Quality leaders
  • Support regulatory document submissions and pre-approval inspections for capital projects

  • Support regulatory document submissions and regulatory inspections for technical transfer and validation activities
  • Provide risk assessments for product quality and compliance and escalate and mitigate risks appropriately

Provide Quality Assurance Oversight including issue and Risk Management for all process engineering and product life cycle management processes

  • Partner with the Global Heads of Process Engineering to ensure robust product life cycle management strategies in place to maintain product quality
  • Responsible for Quality input to Quality by Design principles and processes within R&D product and process development and process engineering
  • Responsible for Quality input to CPV strategy and processes for all CSL products
  • Supports global process, technology and product owners for product life cycle management
  • Responsible for Quality input related to Process & Technology innovation (ie process small scale and computer simulation integration, integration of process analytical technology, external partner technology integration)

Provide Quality Assurance Oversight for Engineering Standards & Engineering Documentation and Knowledge Management

  • Support the development and implementation of global engineering standards and processes consistent with regulatory requirements and industry standards 
  • Support the set up and maintenance of an appropriate Documentation and Knowledge Management system for the Engineering function

Provide Leadership to the Engineering Quality Team:

  • Provide leadership and guidance to the team of Engineering Quality SMEs based at the manufacturing sites to effectively executive on Quality Assurance oversight related to capital projects, validation and technology transfers and life cycle management of our products
  • Set objectives and provide clear direction for execution by the SMEs with respect to Engineering Quality

Member of the Quality Operational Leadership Team and Global Engineering Council

  • Participate at a senior Quality level in the Global Engineering Council
  • Leads Quality Management Review for Engineering systems
  • Member of the Quality Operational Leadership Team across all manufacturing and engineering

Provide Engineering Quality Assurance team leadership

  • Provide leadership and guidance to a global team of Engineering Quality Assurance professionals
  • Set objectives and provide clear direction for execution.
  • Responsible for organizational design and staffing decisions 
  • Recruit, retain, train and develop the Engineering Quality Assurance team.
  • Build and sustain employee engagement by creating a culture of efficient execution and an environment in which individuals and teams can excel and continuously improve

Your profile:

  • Degree in engineering and/or life sciences ; Advanced degree preferred 
  • Minimum of 12 years’ experience in a pharmaceutical or Bio pharmaceutical Company in roles with increasing responsibility in either coming from Quality Management with knowledge in engineering or from Engineering with good knowledge in Quality Oversight
  • Minimum 8 years of managerial experience 
  • Direct experience of QA oversight of validation, technology transfers and capital engineering projects
  • Direct experience executing Quality Assurance function and system within a manufacturing and/or engineering context
  • Experience in interacting to regulatory authorities including submissions and inspections
  • Proven ability to build, mentor and grow a high performing team
  • Ability to influence and motivate others while maintaining a cohesive team environment
  • Demonstrated ability to influence at all organizational levels through clear, concise and impactful verbal and written communication skills
  • In-depth knowledge of cGMP’s, FDA, TGA,  EU and other relevant GxP regulations
  • Knowledge of auditing practices and procedures
  • Effective presentation and meeting skills within all levels of the organization and with external colleagues and collaborators 

We are looking forward to receiving your online application. Applications must include a motivation letter and CV, as well as letters of references and copies of relevant transcripts and/or diplomas in the original language. Please include all these in one document together with the CV.

job.title: Director, Head of Global Sterility Assurance
job.plaincontent:
About CSL
With operations in 35+ nations and ~ 22,000 employees worldwide, CSL is driven to develop and deliver a broad range of lifesaving therapies to treat disorders such as hemophilia and primary immune deficiencies, and vaccines to prevent influenza. Our therapies are also used in cardiac surgery, organ transplantation and burn treatment.
CSL is the parent company of CSL Behring and Seqirus. CSL Behring is a global leader in the protein biotherapeutics industry, focused on bringing to market biotherapies used to treat serious and often rare conditions. CSL Behring operates CSL Plasma , one of the world's largest collectors of human plasma, which is used to create CSL’s therapies. Seqirus is the second largest influenza vaccine company in the world and is a transcontinental partner in pandemic preparedness and a major contributor to the prevention and control of influenza globally.
We invite you to take a look at the many career possibilities available around the globe and consider building your promising future at CSL by becoming a member of our team!
Stellenbeschreibung
For our site in Bern (Or Marburg/Germany, Kankakee/USA) and within the Global Quality Operations business unit, we are looking for a:
Director, Head of Global Sterility Assurance
Reporting to the VP Operational Quality, the Director Sterility Assurance will provide microbiological oversight across all CSL Behring Manufacturing sites, including CSL Plasma Union site and CMOs, to assure that consistent standards for sterility assurance practices are applied across the network.
On this role, you will ensure that sterile manufacturing operations, i.e. processes and facilities meet the required standards in line with international regulations, global policies and SOPs. You will be responsible for significant sterility assurance investigations at each location ensuring a consistent risk assessment approach is used and will be able to provide global direction when issues arise and ensure that all actions taken are fully documented to support follow up investigations.
Further, you should be able to evaluate complex data, derive conclusions, and communicate crisp results to key stakeholders globally, but also have a global view of sterility assurance and the ability to identify risks, trends and related mitigation strategies across sites and CMOs. This role is Global in nature and you will lead the Sterility Assurance SMEs across the network to assure standardized processes and best practices for the QA function. There will be approximately 40% travel foreseen on this role.
Responsibilities:
Develop and oversee the standards for the sterility assurance aspects of the Quality System and ensure their implementation across the network:
- Implement, maintain and continuously improve globally, the sterility assurance standards of the Quality System. These standards include but are not limited to: - Facility cleanliness zones incl. personnel and material flow concepts - Hygiene incl. gowning, cleaning and disinfection concepts - Clean-room behavior and aseptic techniques, operator training and qualification concepts - Raw material test concept - Environmental and utilities monitoring concepts - In-process control concepts and contamination control strategies - Sterilization and aseptic processing concepts - Process simulations (media fill/hold studies) concepts - Container closure integrity concept - Investigation standards for sterility test and media fill failures - Investigation standards for bioburden and microbial environmental / utilities monitoring excursions - Develops and oversees consistent trending systems - Develops an escalations system for trends and critical issues - Design, implement and own the sterility assurance risk assessment process at each manufacturing site and CMOs. - Present key trends, risks and issues at the Global Manufacturing Quality Management Review. - Maintain and share knowledge of changes in regulatory authority requirements.
Coordinate and provide consultation on Sterility Assurance across the network:
- Provide subject matter expertise on sterility assurance best practices and mitigation strategies. - Input into the selection of CMOs and provide appropriate oversight - Contribute to sterile area design, layouts and process flows with Global Engineering - Enable cross functional collaboration/communications on sterility assurance issues across Quality Assurance, the laboratories, Global Engineering and the Manufacturing areas as required. Lead, develop and maintain a Global Community of Standardization expert team for sterility assurance across the network - Evaluate significant deviations from a sterility assurance and QA perspective to identify risks, trends and mitigation strategies that should be implemented across sites - Respond to health authority information requests and inspection observations concerning sterility assurance matters - Develops and supports consistent training connected to sterility assurance - Support Sterility Investigations across sites and escalate emerging trends to key stakeholders - Identify sterility and bio burden issues that present a risk or a trend across sites; escalate emerging trends to key stakeholders and relevant functions. - Ensure each site has a process to ensure that all of operational areas are fully aware of results obtained and trends that are developing ensuring that they have the opportunity to contribute to root cause investigations.
Thought leadership on existing and emerging regulations and external best practices related to areas of Sterility Assurance:
- Understand new/updated regulations and best industry practices and track trends affecting sterility assurance - Ensure that staff are educated on regulatory trends and implications - Educate senior leadership on regulations, best industry practices and respective trends and the impact on operations, including CMOs - Represent CSL Behring at external industry groups for sterility assurance and introduce best practices and standards from these groups
Provide Global Sterility Assurance team leadership:
- Provide leadership and guidance to the team of Sterility Assurance SMEs to effectively executive on Quality Assurance strategies and programs - Set objectives and provide clear direction for execution by the SMEs with respect to sterility assurance
Your profile:
- Graduate level in a related discipline (Microbiology, Virology, Biochemistry, and Pharmaceutical Sciences). Masters/Doctorate Qualification preferred - Minimum of 6 years’ experience in industrial sterility assurance processes - Minimum of 3 years’ experience leading a team with some global input - cGMP background in the Pharmaceutical industry - Experience of Quality Control microbiological testing techniques and industry practices - Business fluency in English - Proven time management skills for planning and schedule of work - Leadership skills in supervision of teams - Knowledge of continuous improvement techniques and advanced root cause analysis techniques - Demonstrated ability to influence at all organizational levels through clear, concise and impactful verbal and written communication skills - In-depth knowledge of cGMP’s, FDA, TGA, EU and other relevant GxP regulations - Maintain in-depth knowledge of pharmaceutical manufacturing industry standards through active engagement in industry associations, e.g. PDA, ISPE etc. - Effective presentation and meeting skills within all levels of the organization and with external colleagues and collaborators - Ability to influence and motivate others while maintaining a cohesive team environment
We are looking forward to receiving your online application. Applications must include a motivation letter and CV, as well as letters of references and copies of relevant transcripts and/or diplomas in the original language. Please include all these in one document together with the CV.
CSL Behring is committed to provide equal employment opportunity for all.

Further, you should be able to evaluate complex data, derive conclusions, and communicate crisp results to key stakeholders globally, but also have a global view of sterility assurance and the ability to identify risks, trends and related mitigation strategies across sites and CMOs.   • Facility cleanliness zones incl. personnel and material flow concepts

  • Clean-room behavior and aseptic techniques, operator training and qualification concepts

  • In-process control concepts and contamination control strategies

  • Process simulations (media fill/hold studies) concepts
  • Container closure integrity concept
  • Investigation standards for sterility test and media fill failures
  • Investigation standards for bioburden and microbial environmental / utilities monitoring excursions
  • Develops and oversees consistent trending systems
  • Develops an escalations system for trends and critical issues
  • Design, implement and own the sterility assurance risk assessment process at each manufacturing site and CMOs.
  • Present key trends, risks and issues at the Global Manufacturing Quality Management Review.
  • Maintain and share knowledge of changes in regulatory authority requirements.

Coordinate and provide consultation on Sterility Assurance across the network:

  • Provide subject matter expertise on sterility assurance best practices and mitigation strategies.
  • Input into the selection of CMOs and provide appropriate oversight
  • Contribute to sterile area design, layouts and process flows with Global Engineering
  • Enable cross functional collaboration/communications on sterility assurance issues across Quality Assurance, the laboratories, Global Engineering and the Manufacturing areas as required. Lead, develop and maintain a Global Community of Standardization expert team for sterility assurance across the network
  • Evaluate significant deviations from a sterility assurance and QA perspective to identify risks, trends and mitigation strategies that should be implemented across sites
  • Respond to health authority information requests and inspection observations concerning sterility assurance matters
  • Develops and supports consistent training connected to sterility assurance
  • Support Sterility Investigations across sites and escalate emerging trends to key stakeholders
  • Identify sterility and bio burden issues that present a risk or a trend across sites; escalate emerging trends to key stakeholders and relevant functions.
  • Ensure each site has a process to ensure that all of operational areas are fully aware of results obtained and trends that are developing ensuring that they have the opportunity to contribute to root cause investigations.

Thought leadership on existing and emerging regulations and external best practices related to areas of Sterility Assurance:

  • Understand new/updated regulations and best industry practices and track trends affecting sterility assurance
  • Ensure that staff are educated on regulatory trends and implications
  • Educate senior leadership on regulations, best industry practices and respective trends and the impact on operations, including CMOs
  • Represent CSL Behring at external industry groups for sterility assurance and introduce best practices and standards from these groups

Provide Global Sterility Assurance team leadership:

  • Provide leadership and guidance to the team of Sterility Assurance SMEs to effectively executive on Quality Assurance strategies and programs
  • Set objectives and provide clear direction for execution by the SMEs with respect to sterility assurance

Your profile:

  • Graduate level in a related discipline (Microbiology, Virology, Biochemistry, and Pharmaceutical Sciences). Masters/Doctorate Qualification preferred
  • Minimum of 6 years’ experience in industrial sterility assurance processes
  • Minimum of 3 years’ experience leading a team with some global input
  • cGMP background in the Pharmaceutical industry
  • Experience of Quality Control microbiological testing techniques and industry practices
  • Business fluency in English
  • Proven time management skills for planning and schedule of work
  • Leadership skills in supervision of teams
  • Knowledge of continuous improvement techniques and advanced root cause analysis techniques
  • Demonstrated ability to influence at all organizational levels through clear, concise and impactful verbal and written communication skills
  • In-depth knowledge of cGMP’s, FDA, TGA, EU and other relevant GxP regulations
  • Maintain in-depth knowledge of pharmaceutical manufacturing industry standards through active engagement in industry associations, e.g. PDA, ISPE etc.
  • Effective presentation and meeting skills within all levels of the organization and with external colleagues and collaborators
  • Ability to influence and motivate others while maintaining a cohesive team environment

We are looking forward to receiving your online application. Applications must include a motivation letter and CV, as well as letters of references and copies of relevant transcripts and/or diplomas in the original language. Please include all these in one document together with the CV.

CSL Behring is committed to provide equal employment opportunity for all.
